Module app.supernaut.fx
Package app.supernaut.fx

Interface FxForegroundApp

All Superinterfaces:
ForegroundApp
All Known Subinterfaces:
FxForegroundApp.FxApplicationCompat
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseFxmlForegroundApp, NoopFxForegroundApp
public interface FxForegroundApp extends ForegroundApp
Supernaut.FX applications must implement this interface.

This is the Supernaut.FX specialization of Supernaut ForegroundApp. Supernaut.FX FxForegroundApps implement this interface instead of subclassing JavaFX Application. This has several advantages over directly extending Application:

  1. Applications implement an interface rather than extend a class. This increases the testability and architectural flexibility of the application.
  2. Abstracts Stage with FxForegroundApp.FxMainView. This also helps with testing.
  3. Supports faster, multi-threaded launching with the FxLauncher interface.
  4. Supports flexible construction of application object hierarchies using Dependency Injection provided by MicronautÂ® framework and possibly other D.I. frameworks in the future.
If you don't care to use the FxForegroundApp.FxMainView abstraction, you can implement FxForegroundApp.FxApplicationCompat and implement the FxForegroundApp.FxApplicationCompat.start(Stage) method which is compatible with Application.start(Stage).

  • Method Details

    • init

      default void init() throws Exception
      The application initialization method. This method is called from the JavaFX init() method after the dependency injection context is initialized and the application is constructed and dependency injected.

      NOTE: This method is not called on the JavaFX Application Thread. An application must not construct a Scene or a Stage in this method. An application may construct other JavaFX objects in this method.

      Specified by:
      init in interface ForegroundApp
      Throws:
      Exception - if something goes wrong

    • start

      default void start(ForegroundApp.SupernautMainView mainView) throws Exception
      Adapt from OpenJFX-independent ForegroundApp to JFX-compatible FxForegroundApp which requires a primary Stage to start.
      Specified by:
      start in interface ForegroundApp
      Parameters:
      mainView - Must be a FxForegroundApp.FxMainView
      Throws:
      Exception - if something goes wrong
      IllegalArgumentException - if mainView isn't a FxForegroundApp.FxMainView

    • start

      void start(FxForegroundApp.FxMainView mainView) throws Exception
      The main entry point for Supernaut.fx applications. Called from Application.start(Stage). At a minimum, you must implement this method.

      NOTE: This method is called on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      Parameters:
      mainView - A wrapper view containing the primary Stage
      Throws:
      Exception - if something goes wrong

    • stop

      default void stop() throws Exception
      This method is called when the application should stop, and provides a convenient place to prepare for application exit and destroy resources.

      NOTE: This method is called on the JavaFX Application Thread.

      Specified by:
      stop in interface ForegroundApp
      Throws:
      Exception - if something goes wrong
